page.title: 14Ascroft's Shop Merebrow.
page.content: The shop is situated on the corner of The Gravel and Marshes Lane. We think the shop was first started by Mr. Thomas Ascroft about 1890. Mr. Ascroft had 4 children, 2 daughters and 2 sons .The daughters Winnie and Daisy would have helped their mother in the shop from the early 1900's. They sold groceries and baked bread, pies and cakes. They also sold tobacco for which they had to have a licence. Wiinnie, who never married, worked in the shop even after her sister left and got married. Winnie still played an active roll up to the early 1970's. She was stone deaf but was a marvellous lip reader. The shop used to deliver groceries to the surrounding area until 1975. Winnie died in January 1976.
